lines.content: * Entry point of the Piper application.
* Initializes the UI, loads tasks from storage, and runs the REPL loop.
* REPL loop accepts user commands until bye is entered.
* @throws PiperException if a recoverable application error occurs.
public static void main(String[] args) throws PiperException {
// mark task as done or undone
int index = taskNumber - 1; // task list starts from index 1 but array list starts from index 0
// task index is outside of array range
throw new PiperException("PEEP! That task flew out of the nest. Please check using 'list' to see which tasks are home!");
throw new PiperException("PEEP! Bad egg. Please check using 'list' to see which tasks are home!");
// user input is an unrecognisable string
throw new PiperException("CHEEP CHEEP! I can't quite sing along with '" + userInput + "'. Wanna try another command?");
* Used to signal invalid input or storage issues with user-friendly messages.
* Creates a PiperException with the given message.
* Parses raw user input into commands and structured arguments.
* Provides helpers to split the command token from the rest of the input.
* Extracts fields for Deadline abd Event classes.
/** Utility class that is not instantiated. */
* Result of splitting a raw input into a command and its argument.
* @param arg remainder of the user input or null if none.
* Structured arguments for a deadline command.
* Structured arguments for an event command.
public EventArgs(String description, String from, String to) {
* Parses a raw line into a command token and its argument.
* @param userInput trimmed line entered by the user.
* @return a ParsedString containing the command and argument or null.
* @throws PiperException if the line is empty or the command is invalid or incomplete.
public static ParsedString parse(String userInput) throws PiperException {
throw new PiperException("CHIRP CHIRP! Don't think you said anything there. Try tweeting a command!");
throw new PiperException("TWEET TWEET! What are we supposed to do? Please specify the description!");
throw new PiperException("TWEET TWEET! What should we look for? Please specify a keyword!");
throw new PiperException("CHIRRUP! Which task should I peck at? Please give me the task index!");
throw new PiperException("CHIRP CHIRP! I don't recognise the tune called '" + cmd + "'. Try another command?");
* Parses a 1-based index from user input.
* @throws PiperException if the string is not a valid integer.
public static int parseIndex(String index) throws PiperException {
throw new PiperException("PEEP! Please give me a numeric task index!");
* Extracts description and /by fields for a deadline.
* @param arg remainder of the user input after the command token.
* @throws PiperException if required parts are missing or empty.
public static DeadlineArgs parseDeadlineArgs(String arg) throws PiperException {
throw new PiperException("OOPS! That deadline's off key. Please format the task as 'deadline (description) /by (deadline)'!");
* Extracts description, /from, and /to fields for an event.
* @param arg remainder of the user input after the command token.
* @throws PiperException if required parts are missing or empty.
public static EventArgs parseEventArgs(String arg) throws PiperException {
throw new PiperException("EEP! Your event's missing a few notes. Please format the event as 'event (description) /from (start time) /to (end time)'!");
* Handles storage of tasks from a UTF-8 text file.
* Each task is stored on a single line.
* The storage path is provided via the constructor.
* On first use, the parent directory and file are created if they do not already exist.
/** Absolute or relative path to the save file. */
* Constructs a Storage for the save file located under savePath.
* @param dir the directory that contains the save file, created if missing.
* @throws PiperException if the provided path cannot be constructed.
public Storage(String dir, String fileName) throws PiperException {
* Loads tasks from the save file into a TaskList.
* If the directory or file does not exist, then they are created and an empty Tasklist is returned.
* @return a TaskList populated with tasks read from disk.
* @throws PiperException if the file cannot be created or read.
throw new PiperException("Unknown task type in storage: " + taskType);
throw new PiperException("SQUAWK! Can't seem to read the save file at " + savePath + ": " + e.getMessage());
* Converts a Task into its on-disk line representation.
* @return the serialized single-line representation of the task.
* Writes all tasks to the save file, overwriting any existing content.
* @throws PiperException if an I/O error prevents writing the file.
public void saveAll(TaskList tasks) throws PiperException {
throw new PiperException("SQUAWK! Can't seem to write tasks to " + savePath + ": " + e.getMessage());
* A task that must be completed by a specific date.
* The constructor accepts the /by field as entered by the user.
* If given the ISO date format yyyy-MM-dd, the date is displayed as MMM d yyyy.
private static final DateTimeFormatter DISPLAYED_DATE = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy");
* A task that spans a start and end date.
* The constructor accepts the /from and /to fields as entered by the user.
* If given the ISO date format yyyy-MM-dd, the date is displayed as MMM d yyyy.
private static final DateTimeFormatter DISPLAYED_DATE = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy");
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
return "[" + this.taskType + "]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + this.formatFromDate() + " to: " + this.formatToDate() + ")";
* Represents a task with a description and completion state.
* Subclasses provide behavior and formatting specific to task type.
* Creates a task with the given description.
* New tasks are marked as undone.
* Returns a single letter to identify task type.
* Returns a status icon used in UI printing.
* @return "X" if task is done, or a single space otherwise.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns the line used to save task to storage.
* A mutable list of Task objects with operations.
* Returns the task at the given zero-based index.
* Adds a task to the end of the list.
* Removes and returns the task at the given index.
* Returns all tasks whose description contains the given keyword.
* The search is case-insensitive and matches if the keyword appears anywhere within the task description.
* The order of tasks returned is the same as in the original task list.
* @return a list of tasks whose description contains the keyword.
* Handles user interaction via the console.
* Provides methods to read user input and print messages.

? "SWEET! I've marked this task as done:\n"

* Prints the current number of tasks in the list.
